titleStmt.title: Iliad X2 = P 263 + P 516 + P 516a + P 522 + P 525 et al.

editionStmt.edition: A new edition, with semantic markup, punctuation, accentuation, emendation, and notes.

respStmt.name: Alexander Loney, ed.
Funghi, M. S. and M. C. Martinelli, "Ostraca leturrari della collezione Finders Petrie: un addendum," ZPE 164 (2008), 163-73;
Tait, J. G., O. Petrie 399-404, 406-8, 471-72 (1930), 140-44.
Crum, W. E. Coptic Ostraca. (1902, London), nos. 523-24.

publicationStmt.publisher: The Center for Hellenic Studies of Harvard University

list.item: Crum, W. E. 1902. Coptic Ostraca. London. nos. 523-24.
Allen-Sutton-West P263, P516, P516a, P522, P525 = [X2]

div.head: Iliad X2
div.note: When Funghi and Martinelli made their later edition of these fragments they could not find all the pieces which Tait and Crum had. I have collated the editions of Tait (1930) with Funghi and Martinelli (2008). However, the differences between the two editions extends to the readings of the same lines of text. Where such differences are irreconcilable the edition of Funghi and Martinelli has been followed. But see notes throughout. For a chart of the fragments and the lines they preserve and their publications, see Funghi and Martinelli 2008, 67.

The two editions differ greatly here. Funghi and Martinelli 2008, 67, believe that there must be typographical error in Tait's edition. Funghi and Martinelli's edition is followed here. For this reason, the accuracy of the rest of the text of O. Petrie 403T + 472T which Tait recorded (lines 6-9 + 25-27) cannot be assured. Therefore, those lines have been excluded from this edition.
div.l: mh=nin a)/eide, qea/, *phlhia/dew *)axilh=os
ou)lome/nhn, h(\ muri/' *)axaioi=s a)/lge' e)/qhke,
polla\s d' i)fqi/mous yuxa\s *)a/idi proi/+ayen
h(rw/wn, au)tou\s de\ e(lw/ria teu=xe ku/nessin
oi)wnoi=si/ de pa=si, *dio\s d' e)telei/eto boulh/,
div.note: Tait records a variant in line 7 of "de" in place of "te." But this is doubtful, seeing as his edition of this fragment has many errors and seeing as Funghi and Martinelli record this very same variant for line 5 (where Tait does not). Quite possibly, the variant in Tait's line 7 actually represents his reading of line 5.
The scribe did not write the lines of the poem as independent lines on the ostracon. Line breaks on the ostracon often occur in the middle of Homeric lines.
The fragment 408T has been lost. According to Tait, it covered lines 13-20 on its recto. The editions of Tait and Funghi and Martinelli are collated here.

div.note: The scribe did not write the lines of the poem as independent lines on the ostracon. Line breaks on the ostracon often occur in the middle of Homeric lines.
Substantial portions of the fragment 472T have been lost. According to Tait, it originally covered lines 21-28 on its verso. The editions of Tait and Funghi and Martinelli are collated here.
